components.description:
A classic sad face. A yellow face with simple, open eyes and wide, steep frown. May convey such feelings as moderate concern or disappointment and affectionate sadness, as when missing a loved one. Its sentiment is usually more intense than üôÅ Slightly Frowning Face, which has a smaller frown.

This smiley predates Unicode emoji support. In its Unicode name of White Frowning Face, white does not refer to skin tone or ethnicity, although Samsung’s early designs colored the face white. See the glossary for the term white in Unicode character names.
components.title: White Frowning Face

description:
A classic sad face. A yellow face with simple, open eyes and wide, steep frown. May convey such feelings as moderate concern or disappointment and affectionate sadness, as when missing a loved one. Its sentiment is usually more intense than üôÅ Slightly Frowning Face, which has a smaller frown.

This smiley predates Unicode emoji support. In its Unicode name of White Frowning Face, white does not refer to skin tone or ethnicity, although Samsung’s early designs colored the face white. See the glossary for the term white in Unicode character names.
title: White Frowning Face

version.description:
Unicode 1.1 were pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by 17 years, and included many characters primarily sourced from the Zapf Dingbats font.

The following characters were added to Unicode in 1993 and many were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: A frowning face¬†with an unhappy mouth curving downward. This face is a¬†more extreme version¬†of the slightly frowning face. See the glossary  http://emojipedia.org/white-frowning-face/
emoji_net_data.name: frowning face

bn:00101571a: Afflicted with or marked by anxious uneasiness or trouble or grief.
Afflicted with or marked by anxious uneasiness or trouble or grief

bn:00110036a: Feeling mentally uncomfortable because something is missing or wrong.
Experiencing or showing sorrow or unhappiness- Christina Rossetti

bn:00088599v: To look angry or sullen, wrinkle one's forehead, as if to signal disapproval.
Look angry or sullen, wrinkle one's forehead, as if to signal disapproval

bn:00036672n: Wrinkling of the brows or face.
A frown is a facial expression in which the eyebrows are brought together, and the forehead is wrinkled, usually indicating displeasure, sadness or worry, or less often confusion or concentration.
A facial expression of dislike or displeasure
The wrinkling of the brows or face in frowning; the expression of displeasure, sullenness, or discontent in the countenance; an angry frown.
A facial expression in which the eyebrows are brought together, and the forehead is wrinkled, usually indicating displeasure, sadness or worry, or less often confusion or concentration.

bn:00068782n: Sadness is emotional pain associated with, or characterized by feelings of disadvantage, loss, despair, helplessness, sorrow, and rage.
Emotions experienced when not in a state of well-being
Sadness is emotional pain associated with, or characterized by feelings of disadvantage, loss, despair, helplessness and sorrow.
